lines.content: **Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
* Kip is a command-line task management application that allows users to manage
* different types of tasks including ToDo, Deadline, and Event tasks.

*

Tasks are automatically saved to a CSV file after each modification
* to ensure data persistence across application sessions.
* Displays formatted output with decorative borders for better user experience.
* @param text The text to be displayed
* Main entry point for the Kip application.

*

This method initializes the application, loads existing tasks from storage,
* and enters the main command loop where it continuously processes user input
* until the user issues a 'bye' command.

*

The application supports the following command formats:

output("Hello! I'm Kip
What can I do for you?

"
+ "Note: Task descriptions and dates cannot contain commas (,) "
output("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
out = "Here are the tasks in your list:\n";
out += "Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";
// After every modification to the task list, save all tasks to the file.
// Could be optimized by saving only the modified task to the file.
output("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n"
output("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n"

case TODO: // eg: todo read book
case DEADLINE: // eg: deadline read book /by 2019-10-15 or deadline read book /by 2019-10-15 1800
output("Got it. I've added this task:\n"
+ "\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
case EVENT: // eg: event read book /from 2019-10-15 /to 2019-10-16 or event read book /from 2019-10-15 1800 /to 2019-10-16 2000
output("Got it. I've added this task:\n"
+ "\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
output("ERROR!!! Please provide a valid task number.");

* Utility class for parsing user input and CSV data in the Kip task management system.

*

The Parser class provides comprehensive parsing functionality for:

*

This class handles multiple date formats and ensures data integrity
* by validating input and preventing CSV format corruption.

*

Since the application uses CSV format for data storage, commas in input
* strings would break the parsing logic. This method ensures data integrity.
* @param fieldName The name of the field for error messages
* @throws InvalidDateException if the input contains commas
private static void validateNoCommas(String input, String fieldName)
+ ": Cannot contain commas (,) as they break the CSV format. "
* Parses a date string in yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd HHmm format to LocalDateTime.

* Handles persistent storage of tasks using CSV file format in the Kip task management system.

*

The Storage class provides functionality to save and load tasks from a CSV file,
* ensuring data persistence across application sessions. It automatically creates
* the storage file if it doesn't exist and handles all file I/O operations.

*
  • datetime1: Deadline date or event start time

*

All file operations are performed on the tasks.csv file located in the
/** Path to the CSV file for storing tasks */
/** Header line for the CSV file */
* Loads tasks from the CSV file.

*

This method reads the CSV file and reconstructs Task objects from the stored data.
* If the file doesn't exist, it creates a new empty file. The method handles all
* three task types and automatically marks tasks as done if they were previously

*

Error handling is implemented to skip invalid lines and continue loading
* valid tasks, ensuring the application remains robust even with corrupted data.
* @return ArrayList of loaded tasks, empty list if file is new or empty
// Create file if it doesn't exist
return tasks; // Return empty list for new file
// First line is data, parse it
* Saves tasks to the CSV file.

*

This method writes all tasks in the provided list to the CSV file, overwriting
* any existing content. The file is created if it doesn't exist. Each task is
* converted to its CSV representation based on its type.

*
  • ToDo: Only type and description are stored

*
  • Deadline: Type, description, and deadline date are stored

*
  • Event: Type, description, start time, and end time are stored
* @param tasks ArrayList of tasks to save
public Deadline(String description, String by) throws InvalidDateException {

* Abstract base class representing a task in the Kip task management system.

*

Task is the foundation class for all task types in the system. It provides
* common functionality such as description management, completion status tracking,

*

This class is designed to be extended by specific task types like ToDo,
* Deadline, and Event, which add their own specialized behavior while inheriting
/** The description or title of the task */
/** Flag indicating whether the task has been completed */
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description.

*

The task is initially marked as not done (incomplete).
* @param description The description or title of the task
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if description is null or empty
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Task description cannot be null or empty");

* @return "X" if the task is done, " " (space) if not done
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns whether the task has been completed.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise

*

This method sets the completion status to true, indicating
* that the task has been finished.
* Marks the task as not completed.

*

This method sets the completion status to false, indicating
* that the task is still pending or has been reopened.
* Returns a string representation of the task.

*

The format is: [status] description, where status is either
* a space ( ) for incomplete tasks or X for completed tasks.
